meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a scale of temperature on which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees under standard atmospheric pressure.
meanings.sent1: The centigrade weather forecast predicted a chilly day ahead.
meanings.sent2: She set the oven to a centigrade temperature for baking the cake.
meanings.sent3: The centigrade thermometer decided to take a break after a long day of measuring temperatures.
meanings.sent4: His love for ice cream was as intense as a centigrade heatwave.
meanings.sent5: The centigrade scale made it easy to understand the temperature changes.

meanings.definition: A unit of temperature on the centigrade scale.
meanings.sent1: The scientist recorded the temperature in centigrade on the chart.
meanings.sent2: The pool water was a refreshing 25 centigrade on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent3: The centigrade on the thermometer seemed to be playing hide and seek with the mercury.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement rose like the centigrade reading on a sunny afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The centigrade measurement helped in determining the ideal room temperature.
